title: Kerala : Mumbai , Kerala Blasters Look To Build On Unbeaten Starts |
body_text:
- News
- City News
- mumbai News
- Mumbai, Kerala Blasters look to build on unbeaten starts
Trending
This story is from October 8, 2023
Having begun the defence of their League Winners’ Shield with a 2-1 win at NorthEast followed by a battling 2-2 draw with Odisha in Bhubaneswar, Des Buckingham’s side fell to their second straight defeat in the AFC Champions League, losing 3-0 to Uzbek side Navbahor in Namangan last week.
Despite returning from an exhausting trip to Uzbekistan empty-handed, Buckingham said his side were in good spirits and eager to finally play in front of their home fans.
“The mood is good. We have had a big travel week. But, we have got everyone fit and fresh. Everyone is available for tomorrow (Sunday),’ Buckingham said at his pre-match press conference on Saturday. “We have had a good start in our ISL campaign — two tough away games against NorthEast and Odisha where we have come back with four points out of six. So we are very much looking forward to getting back out at the MFA and playing in front of our home fans,” the English coach added.
Kerala Blasters have made light of the absence of head coach Ivan Vukomanovic, who is currently serving his 10-match suspension for calling off his players during last season’s controversial playoff clash with Bengaluru. With assistant boss Frank Dauwen filling in, Blasters have started the new ISL season with two wins from as many games.

Mumbai, Kerala look to build on unbeaten starts
Mumbai City FC is looking forward to their first home fixture of the season against Kerala Blasters. Despite a tough trip to Uzbekistan for the AFC Champions League, Mumbai City FC is in good spirits and eager to play in front of their home fans. Kerala Blasters, who have started the season with two wins, are aware of the challenge they face against Mumbai. Mumbai City FC is determined to make amends for their struggles in the Champions League and is hoping to maintain their level of football in the ISL games.

Adrian Luna seals 1-0 win for Kerala Blasters FC against Jamshedpur FC
Kerala Blasters FC secured a hard-fought 1-0 victory over Jamshedpur FC in the Indian Super League (ISL). The winning goal came in the 74th minute from Blasters' captain, Adrian Luna. After an error from Jamshedpur's defense, Luna chipped the ball over the goalkeeper to score. Despite Jamshedpur's offensive efforts, they were unable to find the net. Luna's performance was outstanding, with a high passing accuracy and contributing to the team's victory. Kerala Blasters FC will face Mumbai in their next fixture, while Jamshedpur FC will host Hyderabad FC.

ISL: Adrian Luna stars as Kerala Blasters beat Jamshedpur FC 1-0 to register 2nd successive win
Adrian Luna scored a goal in the 74th minute to secure a 1-0 victory for Kerala Blasters against Jamshedpur FC in the Indian Super League (ISL). The match remained goalless in the first half, but Luna combined with Dimitrios Diamantakos to break the deadlock. Despite attempts from Jamshedpur to equalize, Kerala Blasters' goalkeeper Sachin Suresh made impressive saves to deny them. Luna's goal helped Kerala Blasters secure their second consecutive win in ISL-10.
